items.definition: This issue type encompasses critiques related to the robustness, fairness, and clarity of the methodological choices and experimental setups presented in the paper.
This issue type pertains to the clarity and consistency of theoretical concepts, assumptions, and derivations presented in the paper.
This issue type pertains to inquiries and explanations regarding the methodological choices and assumptions made in the research.
Concerns regarding the adequacy and fairness of baseline comparisons in experimental evaluations.
This issue type encompasses doubts and critiques regarding the experimental design, validation, and overall methodological rigor of the study.
This issue type involves defending or justifying methodological choices and experimental setups in the research.
This issue type involves enhancing the empirical support for claims made in the research through additional experiments and data analysis.
Requests for clarification and justification regarding experimental setups and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and validity of results.
This issue type involves providing or requesting additional empirical evidence to clarify or support claims made in the research.
This issue type involves defending and justifying methodological choices and experimental designs in the context of efficiency and performance metrics.
This issue type pertains to the evaluation and defense of the novelty of contributions in a research paper.
Issues related to enhancing the clarity and communication of concepts and findings in the manuscript.
